messages.message:
Has anyone ever seen an error like the following:
```2022/06/03 13:30:18 ERROR utils/db/session/dbsession.go:373 -- SQL DB: Begin statement failed: ORA-00000: DPI-1047: Cannot locate a 64-bit Oracle Client library: "dlopen(libclntsh.dylib, 0x0001): tried: 'libclntsh.dylib' (no such file), '/usr/local/lib/libclntsh.dylib' (mach-o file, but is an incompatible architecture (have 'x86_64', need 'arm64e')), '/usr/lib/libclntsh.dylib' (no such file), '/Users/Marnadi/instabase/core-services/file-tservice/grpc-file-service/src/go/src/instabase/fileservice/libclntsh.dylib' (no such file)". See https://oracle.github.io/odpi/doc/installation.html#macos for help```
I'm using miniconda with Python 3.7
Thanks for the reply Lenny! I tried doing that earlier, but I think the issue is with the architecture `(have 'x86_64', need 'arm64e')` part of the error

ah yes you're totally right, sorry I misread the error — maybe make sure you have rosetta 2 installed, and you have your terminal set to run to run in x86 mode? then try to clean/rebuild the service that is generating this error
(if you change the rosetta setting for iterm/terminal make sure you restart the app so the change takes effect)
Hmm, I'm Rosetta as well. Is there anything further I need to do in terminal to run in x86 mode?

no the rosetta setting should do the trick I think — my best guess is that something was installed or compiled as an arm binary when it should be an x86 binary, but not 100% sure, sorry :disappointed: unfortunately I dont have an m1, maybe someone who does can jump in to help debug
No worries, thanks for the help anyways!
